main event: Two sightings of unidentified flying objects were reported by qualified Ground Observer Corps observers in Lockport and Tonawanda, New York on July 26-27, 1952.
interesting points: The first sighting was of a white, round object the size of a basketball that was observed for about 3 seconds at an altitude of 5,000 feet.
The second sighting was of a bright, triangular-shaped 'ball of fire' that maneuvered erratically and gained altitude rapidly before disappearing.
Both sightings were made by qualified observers, one with a private pilot's license.
No meteorological activity or physical evidence was reported, and no intercept action was taken.
The sightings occurred on two separate occasions, at 10:00 PM and 3:15 PM/9:54 AM the next day.
sighted object: a white, round object and a bright, triangular-shaped 'ball of fire'
witnesses: qualified Ground Observer Corps observers, including one with a private pilot's license
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
